column1: You or your child had surgery to repair an inguinal hernia caused by a weakness in the abdominal wall in your groin area.
Rest and gentle movement are important for recovery.
- The incision is covered with a bandage.
- You or your child may have pain, soreness, and stiffness at first, especially when moving about.
- Men may have swelling and pain in their testicles.
- You or your child may have trouble passing urine for the first few days.
DO NOT take a bath, soak in a hot tub, or go swimming for the first week after surgery.
Older boys and men may want to wear an athletic supporter if they have swelling or pain in the testicles.
